data.title: Mohamed AlHammadi
data.text:
A journalist, writer, speaker, and media expert. He is currently Chairman Of The Board Of Directors of the UAE Journalists Association and the current Assistant to the President of the General Union of Arab Journalists, the founder and President of Jusoor international center for Media and Development, and currently editor- in-chief of Jusoorpost website, he is the former editor-in-chief of Al Ittihad newspaper, and Former Executive Director of Editing and Publishing at Abu Dhabi Media Company, and former editor-in-chief of National Geographic magazine Arabic version, and former editor-in- chief of AlRoeya newspaper, he assumed responsibilities that were not limited to managing operations and prominent media brands such as Al-Etihad Newspaper, Zahrat Al-Khaleej Magazine, National Geographic Magazine, and Majid Magazine, but instead went beyond developing digital business in the publishing sector in Abu Dhabi media.

AlHammadi is a member of many organizations and associations, he is a member of the Board of Directors of the Gulf Press Union (Manama) and afounding member He is a member of the Young Arab Leaders organization, member of the International Federation of Journalists (Brussels), the Union of Arab Journalists (Cairo), and a board member of the Arab Media Award and a board member of the Executive Bureau of the Asian Federation of Journalists.

AlHammadi received many awards, including the Federal Personality of the Year Award from the Emirates Center for Strategic Studies and Research (2012), the Sheikh Hamdan bin Zayed Al Nahyan Award for Humanitarian Action (2013), the Sheikh Rashid bin Saeed Al Maktoum Award for Scientific Excellence (1995), and the Distinguished Journalist Award from Dubai Press Club (2001), an award for the best newspaper article in the Tarim Omran press award (2003).

AlHammadi has published books such as: “The Time of the Tribulation” (2008), “Emirates Democracy” (2009), “And Autumn Brotherhood” (2016), He has written more than 4,000 articles on local and global issues, as well as his media posts politically on global, regional, and local TV channels. It is also a participant and active component of social media.
